intro: Allasia payos, commonly known as the Payos wormwood, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clustered inflorescences, and bloom in the summer months. Allasia payos is known for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal medicine.
